title: Foothold on Antarctica
creator_credit: James Carr, British Information Services and World Wide Pictures
brief_description: As a preliminary to the crossing of the Antarctic continent by Sir Vivian Fuchs and his party, an advance group set out from London in the m.v. “Theron”, a Canadian sealing vessel, to establish a base camp. Her month long struggle with the pack ice of the Weddell Sea captured the attention of the world. This film, a record of that journey, received Honourable Mention at the International Festival of Documentary and Expeprimental Cinema, Montevideo, 1958.
